visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a variwide chart. The chart should display labor costs in Europe for the year 2016. The title of the chart should be 'Labor Costs in Europe, 2016'. The x-axis should be of type 'category' and should be reversed, with a title indicating that column widths are proportional to GDP. The chart should have a subtitle with a source link to Eurostat. The legend should be disabled. The data series should include labor costs for various European countries, with data labels formatted to show the cost in euros. The tooltip should display both labor costs and GDP in euros. The chart should use custom colors for each data point.

title.text: Column widths are proportional to GDP

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a variwide chart, which is a type of chart where the width of each column is proportional to a third value (in this case, GDP). The chart displays labor costs in various European countries for the year 2016. The title of the chart is 'Labor Costs in Europe, 2016', and it includes a subtitle with a link to the Eurostat source. The x-axis is of type 'category' and is reversed, meaning the categories are displayed from right to left. The x-axis title indicates that the column widths are proportional to GDP. The legend is disabled, and the data series includes labor costs for each country, with data labels formatted to show the cost in euros. The tooltip provides additional information, displaying both labor costs and GDP in euros. The chart uses custom colors for each data point, ensuring a distinct visual representation for each country.
